name: SMEAR II
long_name: Station for Measuring Ecosystem-Atmospere Relations II
description: SMEAR II is a rural continental station surrounded by a rather homogeneous coniferous boreal forest, located in southern Finland 60 km northeast from Tampere. The station is equipped with extensive facilities to measure forest ecosystem–atmosphere interactions continuously and comprehensively.

data_table.name: RH
data_table.method: Calculated from dewpoint (1996.01.01-2012.05), Rotronic MP102H RH sensor (2012.06-Now)

data_table.name: rad_glob
data_table.method: Reemann TP3 pyranometer, range 300 - 4800 nm (1996.01 - 2008.06), Middleton SK08 pyranometer (2008.07 - 2017.08), Middleton EQ08 pyranometer (2017.09 - )

data_table.name: rad_diff
data_table.method: Reemann TP 3 pyranometer with shading ring

data_table.name: CO2_flux
data_table.method: Gill Solent 1012R anemometer/thermometer and LI-COR LI-6262 infrared absorption gas analyser (2001.08 - 2018.03), Gill HS-50 anemometer/thermometer and LI-COR LI-7200 infrared absorption gas analyser (2018.04 - )

data_table.name: SO2
data_table.method: TEI 43B UV fluorescence analysers (1996.01 - 2004.01), TEI 43CTL UV fluorescence analysers (2004.01 - 2010.09), TEI 43iTL UV fluorescence analysers (2010.09 - )

reference.Hari2005: Hari and Kulmala, Boreal Environ. Res., 10, 315–322, 2005.

reference.Junninen2009: Junninen et al., Boreal Environ. Res., 14, 447–457, 2009.
